alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:51PM PDT until August 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT MONDAY FOR VENTURA COUNTY... At 951 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported dangerous and life threatening flash flooding across the warned area. Rock and mudslides have also been occuring. Between 1.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area, highest in the mountains. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain from Tropical Storm Hilary producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges, reported by law enforcement. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, western Malibu, Ojai, Chatsworth, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Newbury Park, Ventura Harbor, Point Mugu State Park, Point Mugu, Lockwood Valley, Oak Park and Topatopa Peak. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Say off the roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
